intro: Echinocereus ehrenbergii var. cristatus, commonly known as the Honeycomb Cactus, is a unique and striking cactus native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, flattened, rib-like structure that forms a honeycomb-like pattern, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is a slow-growing, cold-hardy species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Its compact size and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
